item.description:
“Poor voice work?” What the fuck game were they playing?

item.title: Eurogamer review
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
metalmunki:

Second only to Rock, Paper, Shotgun in my book. Hurrah, the British!

I was half-expecting a “Wot I think” for Black Mesa these days from Rock, Paper Shotgun, but I don’t think they’ve made one yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Eurogamer review
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
This stands in complete contrast to the negative and bad review that was made by Valvetime.net

https://www.valvetime.net/threads/valvetime-video-review-black-mesa.225109/

item.title: Eurogamer review
item.dc:creator: metalmunki
item.description:
MrFob:

I love Eurogamer. They usually write the best reviews out there and this one is no exception. I don’t necessarily agree with their take on the HECU but other than that, it’s spot on and very well written. Nice!

Second only to Rock, Paper, Shotgun in my book. Hurrah, the British!

Read full topic

item.title: Eurogamer review
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
I like this review. I agree with most of their points. Especially the one about Black Mesa becoming a “character” (and the most prominent one) in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Eurogamer review
item.dc:creator: BunnySlippers
item.description:
It genuinely feels like something of an insult to its creators that we can all sample the fruits of their extensive labour for free. One can only hope that Uncle Valve might find a way to reward them for their startling act of devotion.

This!!!

Read full topic
